23969326: A Guest Sweetfull of character.Warm exposed beautifully finished timber with mist green finishings appointing a summer feel.Private balcony with amazing northerly views and beautiful sunrises.Located upstairs of the main residence with complete self contained amenities.Hosted by Mel (Dad).'

247725615: Very well presented and clean. Welcoming atmosphere with great ammenities. Suitable for short or long stay. I will be back
31035275: I use ABB often and this is one of the best stays I have had. The accommodation is clean quiet and appealing. You can’t go wrong !
62567726: Stayed 4 nights here in mid-June. The apartment was warm, nicely organised, and well set up, with an induction stove and electric frypan to use. Having a decent size mini-fridge, with small freezer compartment, was really valuable. Lovely views from the balcony and windows. The stairs are a little tight and might worry some carrying a load or those who are a bit wobbly, but otherwise are fine. Location is lovely, on a rise overlooking the town and plains to the north, and quite walkable into town.
25321630: Jeff's place was very good value for money, very private and clean, we had a relaxing time staying here. The view from the little verandah was outstanding.
253784659: Great place to stay. Lovely location with everything you need. Highly recommended.
22358394: Fabous value in a great location for a visit to Bathurst.
73611794: it is a sweet and warm stay in Mel's,good view,and  close to the shopping  centre as well. must try "The terrace Thai", only 7 mins walking from the place. Mel is very nice, and he replied very quickly when we need help. :)
55231742: This place is warm & cosy & has nice woodwork walls & ceiling.  As it’s an attic type accommodation in summer you’d need to use the aircon.  Plenty of amenities including a hairdryer & bbq on balcony.  There is a separate walkin wardrobe/ironing room.  Recommend this place as value for money.
93746494: The place was squeaky clean! Great communication and easy access of keys. Some surprise storage door spaces in the accommodation. Location is as a great bonus from town and local shops, and night life. Only down side is the persistent noise on the roof at night time.
156757725: This is a lovely loft apartment that is very comfortable, clean and well equipped. The outdoor veranda space is an added bonus and there is a lovely view of the countryside and hills.
171205521:
This was a really quaint space but surprisingly roomy with a lovely deck to sit and enjoy the views over the valley.
Fairly steep stairs but worth the climb
52519018: Great place to stay. Homey and very spacious
196701621: Very tidy and homely would definitely recommend if you need a place to stay in bathurst.

28916070: Make yourself at home in this tiny cottage. Warm, bright and comfortable you will find everything you need to enjoy your short stay here. An easy walk to everything that Bathurst has to offer.'

32176934: Cute little cottage, Central to the main street with everything you need. The cottage was spotless and nice and warm when we arrived.
158278557: Rae's cottage is a beautiful warm and cosy place, very close to central Bathurst. It's a delightful place to stay.
217825314: What a beautiful cottage. It was so warm inside when we arrived on a cold winters night. The cottage was extremely clean and much bigger than we expected. A well stocked fridge and pantry was such a help. It absolutely served us well. Would have no hesitation in recommending it to others.
28362726: Great location within a few minutes walk of the main street with great cafes and restaurants as well as all the shops. The cottage is small, so just right for two people. Has all the amenities that you need with very comfortable beds and a kitchen stocked with condiments if you want to cook. Heaters throughout so we were toasty warm. I nice touch to have the heaters on before we arrived so lovely to walk into a cosy, welcoming feel. Also nice to have the history of the cottage there for us to read. Would highly recommend for anyone spending time around Bathurst and the goldfields.
12044349: A cosy, cute cottage in a good location. This accommodation was immaculately presented and had many extra touches like local information, cushions, throw rugs, ample heating, chocolates, breakfast items, kitchen supplies and lots of condiments. A perfect place for couples to stay. Communication with Raelene was easy and I would certainly recommend this small, stylish cottage in Bathurst.
242416955: An awesome cosy little Cottage! Really central and clean and tidy.

28680036: "The Ivy Lodge" is a beautifully restored and furnished heritage 2-bedroom Cottage with Lounge & ButlerPantry, located in the heart of Bathurst. It is a great base for the Bathurst 1000, and is walking distance to Restaurants & Bars & Public Transport.'

133430735: Well located and extremely well presented cottage close to Bathurst CBD, very nice renovation!
268910822: Benny was a fantastic host and very helpful with directions!

2034511:
This hideaway accommodation is excellent in every way.

9653444: Clean, comfortable, private and family friendly. We would very happily stay here again.

27798031: Thanks for a great stay Elle.

263404589: This little house is lovely, clean, warm and sweet. Walking distance from town. Loved it.

59947929: You cant go wrong with this little gem. Great location, sparkling clean and cosy warm.
227358836:
Jasmine’s historic house in Bathurst was exactly as described, fully renovated, great location and sparkling clean. The house has been stylishly restored, maintaining some of the Bathurst rustic charm that comes with a historic home. 

The underfloor heating is an absolute blessing and came in handy for our visit as temperatures got down to 1 degree, and the off street parking provides that extra bit of security.

The house is well appointed with everything you need to make a home away from home. Of course, you will find coffee/tea facilities and various amenities like an iron, or washer dryer as usual, but Jasmine surprised us with some lovely little touches such as Monte Carlo biscuits, fruit, and even a few things for breakfast, which came in handy given our family of 5 was very hungry and slightly underprepared, arriving in the late afternoon. 

Jasmine herself was an excellent host, always available for contact, providing very clear instructions to enable us a speedy checkin/checkout and a comfortable stay.

Thank you Jasmine for hosting our second ever AirBNB stay and making us feel so comfortable.
213822627: This is a charming old cottage, with a couple of quirks. Clean, tidy, and warmly welcoming with the gas heating on a cold night. 264023591: very much a surprise inside, very well appointed ,very comfortable ,close to Panthers ,pubs and cafes, all within walking distance, heating was turned on for when we got there, supplies like milk, bread, biscuits were supplied, awesome !
162964141: Perfect place to stay in Bathurst!
55513206: We really enjoyed staying here.  It was easy walking distance to the shops, etc and the off-street parking was very helpful. We would stay here again.

14516439: Great clean space, perfect for a weekend getaway, but the rental would be just as suitable to stay in for a week plus. Easy check in, great communication from the hosts. Location is great too 20 min walk into the towns bars and pubs, or a cheap uber ride. Highly recommend!

28886545: Fantastic value for money and really close to central Bathurst. The photos don't do this place justice. It has a nice big TV and the internet is fine for general use. Everything from the flowers, chocolates, cereal, milk, bread and more.
Thank you so much..
90118951:

261510003: Very spacious, clean space to stay in and a very convenient walk to town. Would recommend, we enjoyed ourselves in Paul and Terry’s home.
250628514: We went to Bathurst for a school soccer championships & turned it into a little holiday! We drove through snow on our way into Bathurst & it was so lovely to arrive to the fire going & complimentary chocolates (the kids loved these!) there are 2-3 living spaces that are well heated. The garden is beautiful even though we didn’t get out there that much as it was so chilly the kids enjoyed running around, playing soccer & rolling in the autumn leaves. The kitchen had everything we needed. & the beds were so snuggley & comfy. Even the kids commented on how well they slept! Paul & Terry were very responsive to any questions, & the house really feels like home. We would definitely stay again at Peppinella!

18320857: Cosy heritage-style residence with 3 bedrooms and 1 bathroom (separate toilet), small lounge area, full kitchen and small shady backyard. Central location in a quiet street; within 15-20 mins easy walking distance to Bathurst cafes, restaurants, supermarkets, pubs and clubs. Little Blandford is a 4km walk, or 8 minute drive from Mount Panorama.'

9510293: We had a great stay at Carolyn's place would recommend and would like to stay again
22273142: My second time at Carolyn's: I love this house, stylish and so many nice touches. There can't be a better place to stay in Bathurst in my opinion
50939267: The cottage is stylishly decorated whilst keeping its original charm. Incredibly clean, smelled amazing. Great location on a deceptively quiet street adjacent to the main road. It was very cold when we arrived and there were plenty of heaters to keep us comfortable. The array of amenities is incredible - from bottle openers to iPhone chargers and everything in between. Would highly recommend this host!
220248736: It’s a beautiful place with nice subtle touches all around the house. We loved our stay and would definitely recommend Carolyn’s place to everyone. Carolyn herself was an awesome host, always maintained a clear line of communication, very helpful and great to deal with.
14568314: Great place in an excellent location, oh and super comfy bed
238161615: Clean, tidy and homely. Lots of extra little touches.
230715232: Really enjoyed our stay. Felt very well looked after. Highly recommended!
69717104:
Carolyn's house was a perfect base for three of us attending a soccer tournament at Proctor Park. Great communication with Carolyn before the stay, easy lock-box check-in and a sparkling clean house made our arrival after a long drive very welcoming.

The house is old but very nicely renovated. It's got three good sized bedrooms with fans, a well-equipped lounge room with heaps of DVDs and puzzles for the kids (lifesaver!), a fantastic kitchen, lovely rain shower, big laundry with a washer and dryer (well-used by us cleaning soccer gear) and a wonderfull back yard with a rotary clothesline. The breakfast pack was a great surprise (bread, spreads, milk, cereal, eggs...) and added to the welcome.

The house is about 50metres up from the highway so no road noise & great sleeps. A good pub (Dunstan Hotel) 5 minutes walk down the road for dinner; petrol station on the corner. 'Town' proper is a couple of minutes drive.

We thoroughly enjoyed out stay here and will certainly be back when next in Bathurst. Thank you Carolyn for making us all feel so welcome!
1324889: A lovely, clean, tidy and comfortable house in a good location. Would definitely stay again.
99584609: Little Blandford cottage was a great base while staying in Bathurst. It is close to everything you could need, the house is stylish and comfortable and there are many little touches that make it warm and welcoming. Would recommend to anyone going to Bathurst.
156497665: Thanks Carolyn - very warm and inviting home - we had a very comfortable stay and your hospitality and thoughtful additions including the breaky, coffee machine and goodies you left for us is very much appreciated. R. Rod
50030926: Little Bedford is well located, very generous in ammenities, very comfortable with great furnishings. A great selection for breakfast I supplied. It is great value for money. Little Bedford is most accomodating.
52955763: Carolyn was terrific to deal with and communication was prompt and clear. Accommodation was well appointed, clean and met all our needs. We wouldn’t hesitate to book again next time we’re in Bathurst!
2234853: Great space, nicely decorated, really lovely touches throughout (lots of soap, cleaning products, kitchen utensils, all the things that make a stay great plus bonuses like chocolates and basic brekky supplies. A huge backyard with table and chairs for whiling away the evening, and a beautiful front porch for sitting and reading and watching the world go by. Plus the unexpected surprise of a stand mixer that meant we could make the Christmas pavlova! Thanks for having us, Carolyn.
5312313: A very comfortable cottage within an easy walk to Bathurst CBD. Had a great weekend exploring the local area and was lucky to find the local Farmer's Markets happening on the Saturday morning. Thanks
45476466: Amazing - we loved this gorgeous home and all the thoughtful touches - also so many tea/coffee/food options - wow! And the decor was stunning! A must stay when in Bathurst! We will return!
5508815: A perfect little cottage for our trip down to Bathurst. Carolyn had added so many thoughtful touches, we felt completely looked after. Lovely, tidy spaces all with a touch of character. Would definitely stay again!
